department.dept_long_name: Department of the History of Science

course.title: Secrecy, Security, Surveillance
course.description: Over the course of the last hundred years-from World War I to the present-the world has assembled a massive system of state secrecy, censorship, security and surveillance. This course introduces the problem, tracking not only how the national and now global system of watching and archiving came into place, but exploring the consequences of this apparatus for identity, deliberation, and democracy. Enrollment limited to 12, by permission of the instructor.
